error.signature: pip._vendor.urllib3.exceptions.MaxRetryError: Could not fetch URL: There was a problem confirming the ssl certificate

verdict.summary: SSL certificate verification failed when connecting to PyPI or custom index. Usually caused by corporate MITM proxy injecting its own certificate, outdated system CA certificates, or custom index with self-signed cert.

dead_ends.why_fails: Disables SSL verification which is a security risk; does not fix the underlying certificate issue

dead_ends.action: Downgrade to an older pip that is less strict about SSL
dead_ends.why_fails: Older pip versions have security vulnerabilities; SSL strictness is intentional

workarounds.how: apt-get update && apt-get install ca-certificates && update-ca-certificates

workarounds.action: Point pip to the corporate CA bundle: pip install --cert /path/to/corporate-ca.crt <package>
workarounds.how: pip config set global.cert /path/to/corporate-ca-bundle.crt && pip install <package>

leads_to.condition: when SSL negotiation fails and connection times out

preceded_by.condition: when proxy injects SSL certificate that fails verification

frequently_confused_with.distinction: SSL error is about certificate validation failure; proxy error is about inability to establish connection through the proxy itself
